New Records: Chicago White Sox starter Chris Flexen extended his winless streak to 21 consecutive starts, setting a team record
Key Match Events: Dominic Fletcher's RBI double in the ninth inning sparked a five-run rally
Pre-Game Insights: Chicago White Sox starter Chris Flexen had a winless streak of 21 consecutive starts, the longest in team history
Post-Match Reflections: Boston Red Sox manager Alex Cora noted the team's offensive struggles, while Chris Flexen expressed pride in his performance despite the loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Chicago White Sox were on pace to set a record for the most losses since 1900, and the team had recently struggled in their previous games
